Package database_access

Class AppointmentsAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • database_access.AppointmentsAccess
  • public class AppointmentsAccess
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to interact with the Appointments table in the MySQL database. It provides other classes and methods access to the Appointment objects stored locally in the appointment ObservableList. It can add, update and delete Appointment objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      AppointmentsAccess()

      • AppointmentsAccess

        public AppointmentsAccess()

    • Method Detail

      • getAllAppointments

        public static void getAllAppointments()
        Uses a SELECT SQL call to retrieve all objects from the appointment table in the MySQL database and adds them to an ObservableList. It also converts TIMESTAMP values to LocalDateTime and customer/contact IDs to int.

      • getAppointmentlist

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<AppointmentsObj> getAppointmentlist()
        Returns a copy of the ObservableList "appoinmentlist" so that it can be viewed in the UI and modified using CRUD techniques.
        Returns:
        a copy of the ObservableList

      • addAppointment

        public static void addAppointment​(int contactID,
                                  int customerID,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  java.lang.String description,
                                  java.lang.String location,
                                  java.lang.String type,
                                  java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                                  java.time.LocalTime startTime,
                                  java.time.LocalDate endDate,
                                  java.time.LocalTime endTime)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes in input from the Add Appointment form, turns it into a INSERT SQL statement, and adds it to the Appointments table in the mySQL database.
        Parameters:
        contactID - the contact ID
        customerID - the customer ID
        title - name of the appointment
        description - brief summary of the appointment
        location - the place of the appointment
        type - category of the appointment
        startDate - the Start Date day/month of the appointment (combined with startTime in LocalDateTime method)
        startTime - the Start Date hour/minutes of the appointment (combined with startDate in LocalDateTime method)
        endDate - the End Date day/month of the appointment (combined with endTime in LocalDateTime method)
        endTime - the End Date hour/minutes of the appointment (combined with endDate in LocalDateTime method)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - prevents app from crashing when incorrect SQL syntax is used

      • updateAppointment

        public static void updateAppointment​(int appointmentID,
                                     int contactID,
                                     int customerID,
                                     java.lang.String title,
                                     java.lang.String description,
                                     java.lang.String location,
                                     java.lang.String type,
                                     java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                                     java.time.LocalTime startTime,
                                     java.time.LocalDate endDate,
                                     java.time.LocalTime endTime)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates the selected Appointment in the database. Also converts the users local time to UTC when updating.
        Parameters:
        appointmentID - the appointment ID
        contactID - the contact ID
        customerID - the customer ID
        title - name of the appointment
        description - brief summary of the appointment
        location - the place of the appointment
        type - category of the appointment
        startDate - the Start Date day/month of the appointment (combined with startTime in LocalDateTime method)
        startTime - the Start Date hour/minutes of the appointment (combined with startDate in LocalDateTime method)
        endDate - the End Date day/month of the appointment (combined with endTime in LocalDateTime method)
        endTime - the End Date hour/minutes of the appointment (combined with endDate in LocalDateTime method)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - prevents app from crashing when incorrect SQL syntax is used

      • setAppointmentsObj

        public static void setAppointmentsObj​(AppointmentsObj appointment)
        Used to create a temporary static placeholder of an appointment object that is selected to be or was modified.
        Parameters:
        appointment - the selected appointment object

      • getAppointmentObj

        public static AppointmentsObj getAppointmentObj()
        Retrieves a copy of the Appointment object stored in this class. It's used as a placeholder when navigating the other JavaFXML scenes.
        Returns:
        appointment object to be loaded in new scene

      • deleteAppointment

        public static void deleteAppointment​(AppointmentsObj appointmentsObj)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Uses a DELETE SQL call to delete selected object from the appointment table in the MySQL database by appointment ID. If rows are updated in the MySQL database then the current appointment list is cleared and an updated one is retrieved from the database.
        Parameters:
        appointmentsObj - the selected appointment object to be deleted
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - prevents crashes if incorrect SQL syntax is used

      • findMonth

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<AppointmentsObj> findMonth()
        Creates a temporary observable list based on the current months value. It compares it with the ObservableList in this class.
        Returns:
        a temporary, modified, copy of the ObservableList sorted by month/year

      • findWeek

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<AppointmentsObj> findWeek()
        Creates a temporary observable list based on the users system's LocalDateTime.now() value to find appointments 7 days from now.
        Returns:
        a temporary, modified, copy of the ObservableList filtered by appointments starting in 7 days

      • checkForAppointment

        public static void checkForAppointment()
        [LAMBDA expression #1] - This lambda expression uses the interface Consumer T to shorten the method body. The Consumer interface looks for an action. Clicking the OK button is the action and the parameter is represented by the "response" value. If this Lambda wasn't here, more code would be needed in the body to define the alert and the actions.

        Checks for upcoming appointments by using LocalDateTime values upon successful login by user. The appointment alert notifies the user if there is no upcoming appointment or if there is an upcoming appointment starting in the next 15 minutes. Two values are set, the time of now, and the time of now plus 15 minutes. LAMBDA is used for the alert button.

      • findAppointmentType

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> findAppointmentType()
        Creates a String observable list of Type values from the appointmentlist variable in this class. It goes through the list and adds only unique types to the list so it can be used in a search for Reports on the Home page.
        Returns:
        String ObservableList of unique Types

      • getMonths

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.time.Month> getMonths()
        Creates a ObservableList of months from values of the Month class so it can viewed in the UI on the home page in the reports section.
        Returns:
        ObservableList of months

      • isScheduled

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> isScheduled()
        Creates a ObservableList of String values, "Yes"/"No to be selections in the reports section - "Customer Scheduled" of the home page.
        Returns:
        ObservableList of "Yes"/"No" values for users to select on the home page
